pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #15259

### PR summary [da4854e887](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15240/commits/da4854e887c588a7907c2d81e6de0d915bcf57e5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsAffineOpen.fromSpecStalk_closedPoint`
`+ SpecToEquivOfLocalRing`
`+ SpecToEquivOfLocalRing_eq_iff`
`+ Spec_closedPoint`
`+ Spec_fromSpecStalk`
`+ Spec_fromSpecStalk'`
`+ Spec_map_stalkMap_fromSpecStalk`
`+ Spec_map_stalkSpecializes_fromSpecStalk`
`+ Spec_stalkClosedPointIso`
`+ Spec_stalkClosedPointTo_fromSpecStalk`
`+ closed_point_mem_iff`
`+ fromSpecStalk_app`
`+ fromSpecStalk_closedPoint`
`+ germ_stalkClosedPointIso_hom`
`+ germ_stalkClosedPointTo`
`+ germ_stalkClosedPointTo_Spec`
`+ germ_stalkClosedPointTo_Spec_fromSpecStalk`
`+ isLocalRingHom_stalkClosedPointTo`
`+ preimage_eq_top_of_closedPoint_mem`
`+ range_fromSpecStalk`
`+ stalkClosedPointIso`
`+ stalkClosedPointIso_inv`
`+ stalkClosedPointTo`
`+ stalkClosedPointTo_comp`
`+ stalkClosedPointTo_fromSpecStalk`
`+ ΓSpecIso_hom_stalkClosedPointIso_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks, LGTM!
Thanks, LGTM!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
lemma Spec_map_stalkSpecializes_fromSpecStalk {x y : X} (h : x ⤳ y) :
```

```suggestion
lemma Spec_map_stalkMap_fromSpecStalk {x} :
```
Did you forget to move this to `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum`?
Nice catch!

```suggestion
@[stacks 01J7]
```
Cool!

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.range_fromSpecStalk`: The range of the map `Spec 𝒪_{X, x} ⟶ X` is
  exactly the `y` that specialize to `x`.
```
I think it should be `specializes`?
I am not a native speaker, so you might very well be right. I thought that "the `y`" is plural here.
Oh yes you're right the `y` should be plural

```suggestion
  rw [← hV.fromSpecStalk_eq_fromSpecStalk hxV, IsAffineOpen.fromSpecStalk, Scheme.comp_app,
    hV.fromSpec_app_of_le _ hVU, ← X.presheaf.germ_res (homOfLE hVU) x hxV]
  simp [Category.assoc, ← ΓSpecIso_inv_naturality_assoc]
```
Hmm this doesn't work for me.
This is strange, I just copy pasted this into your new version and it still works for me. Probably it is not very important, I just like that we can get rid of the terminal `rfl`.
Oh I thought it was `simp only`. Thanks!

```suggestion
lemma Spec_map_stalkClosedPointIso :
```
Or maybe `Spec.map_stalkClosedPointIso`?
There are more occurrences below. I think we should decide whether `Spec_map_`, `Spec.map_` or `Spec_` is the convention.
Probably `Spec_map_` I guess?

```suggestion
Given a local ring `(R, 𝔪)` and a morphism `f : Spec R ⟶ X`,
they induce a ring homomorphim `φ : 𝒪_{X, f 𝔪} ⟶ R`.
```
Do you understand why `infer_instance` does not work?
I hope/believe #17403 will solve this.
Also this could go to ~`AlgebraicGeometry.Spec`~ `AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme`.

```suggestion
@[simps]
noncomputable
def SpecToEquivOfLocalRing :
```
seems to produce reasonable lemmas here.

```suggestion
  rw [IsAffineOpen.fromSpecStalk, Scheme.comp_val_base_apply]
  rw [← hU.primeIdealOf_eq_map_closedPoint ⟨x, hxU⟩, hU.fromSpec_primeIdealOf ⟨x, hxU⟩]
```

We can get rid of this `erw` by adding a lemma
```
lemma preimage_top (f : X ⟶ Y) : f ⁻¹ᵁ ⊤ = ⊤ :=
  rfl
```
It seems to throw a motive incorrect error for me.

This
```
lemma germ_stalkClosedPointTo_Spec {R S : CommRingCat} [LocalRing S] (φ : R ⟶ S):
    (Spec R).presheaf.germ ⊤ _ trivial ≫ stalkClosedPointTo (Spec.map φ) =
      (ΓSpecIso R).hom ≫ φ := by
  rw [stalkClosedPointTo, Scheme.stalkMap_germ_assoc, ← Iso.inv_comp_eq,
    ← ΓSpecIso_inv_naturality_assoc]
  simp_rw [preimage_top]
  rw [germ_stalkClosedPointIso_hom]
  rw [Iso.inv_hom_id, Category.comp_id]
```
works for me.
Oh `simp_rw`. Makes sense.

With the lemma from above:
```suggestion
  simp_rw [← preimage_top (Spec.map f)]
  rw [← (Spec.map f).app_eq_appLE]
```

```suggestion
    {f : R ⟶ S} [IsLocalRingHom f] : (Spec.map f).base (closedPoint S) = closedPoint R :=
```

```suggestion
    (X.fromSpecStalk x).base (closedPoint (X.presheaf.stalk x)) = x :=
```

```suggestion
    (hU.fromSpecStalk hxU).base (closedPoint (X.presheaf.stalk x)) = x := by
```

```suggestion
    Set.range (X.fromSpecStalk x).base = { y | y ⤳ x } := by
```

```suggestion
    exact ((LocalRing.specializes_closedPoint y).map (X.fromSpecStalk x).base.2).trans
```

```suggestion
    X.presheaf.stalk (f.base (closedPoint R)) ⟶ R :=
```

```suggestion
    {U : Opens X} (hU : f.base (closedPoint R) ∈ U) : f ⁻¹ᵁ U = ⊤ :=
```

```suggestion
lemma germ_stalkClosedPointTo (U : Opens X) (hU : f.base (closedPoint R) ∈ U) :
```

```suggestion
  have : (Spec.map f ≫ X.fromSpecStalk x).base (closedPoint R) = x := by
```

```suggestion
  toFun f := ⟨f.base (closedPoint R), Scheme.stalkClosedPointTo f, inferInstance⟩
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): Classification of `Spec R ⟶ X` with `R` local.
